technufbot package

Module contents

technufbot.download_interview_questions(text, name)[source]

Option to download interview questions generated given a text string

Parameters:

  • text (string) – interview questions that were generated

  • name (string) – name of candidate

technufbot.extract_relevant_sections(text)[source]

Extracts “Scope of Work” and other required sections given a text string

Parameters:

text (string) – String text from a file

Returns:

Returns the relevant sections of that text, if none, will return empty string

Return type:

string

technufbot.extract_text_from_docx(docx_path)[source]

Extracts all text from a docx file into a string

Parameters:

docx_path (string) – File path to the docx file

Returns:

Returns the text from that docx file

Return type:

string

technufbot.extract_text_from_pdf(file_path)[source]

Extracts all text from a PDF file into a string

Parameters:

file_path (string) – File path to the PDF file

Returns:

Returns the text from that PDF file

Return type:

string

technufbot.fill_document(template_path, data)[source]

Fills a word document template with the data dict given a template_path, and lets you download the docx file

Parameters:

  • template_path (string) – path of template file

  • data (dict) – dict of data to replace in the template

technufbot.format_resume(resume)[source]

Takes a resume string and reformats that resume to the format that Technuf uses

Parameters:

resume (string) – String text from a resume file

Returns:

OpenAI generated response formatting the resume

Return type:

string

technufbot.generate_interview_questions(job_description, resume)[source]

Generates interview questions and answers given a job_description string and a resume string

Parameters:

  • job_description (string) – The generated job description

  • resume (string) – String text from a resume file

Returns:

OpenAI generated interview questions

Return type:

string

technufbot.generate_job_description(text)[source]

Generates a job description string in the Technuf format given a text string

Parameters:

text (string) – String text from a file

Returns:

Returns the OpenAI generated job description

Return type:

string

technufbot.generate_proposal(resumes, concise_job_description, job_title)[source]

Generates the proposal given up to 3 resume strings, a concise_job_description string, and a job_title string This returns a data dict with all of the necessary information

Parameters:

  • resumes (list) – list of resumes

  • concise_job_description (string) – a concise version of the job description with uncessary info removed

  • job_title (string) – job title extracted from the file

Returns:

dict with all the data needed to generate the proposal

Return type:

dict

technufbot.generate_resume_descriptions(resume, job_description)[source]

Generates a resume description using OpenAI API for a candidate given a resume string and the job description string

Parameters:

  • resume (string) – Resume from a file

  • job_description (string) – The generated job description

Returns:

OpenAI generated resume description

Return type:

string

technufbot.generate_sos(job_description, data, num, job_title)[source]

Generates a scope of services given a job_description string, a data dict, a num int, and a job title string

Parameters:

  • job_description (string) – The generated job description

  • data (dict) – The dict of content that we will be replacing in the template

  • num (int) – Number of candidates (up to 3)

  • job_title (string) – The extracted job title

Returns:

OpenAI generated sos

Return type:

string

technufbot.get_job_title_docx(text)[source]

Extracts the job title from a docx document using NLP

Parameters:

text (string) – String text from a file

Returns:

Returns the title from that docx file, if not found, returns “No job title found”

Return type:

string

technufbot.get_job_title_pdf(text)[source]

Extracts the job title from a PDF document using NLP

Parameters:

text (string) – String text from a file

Returns:

Returns the title from that PDF file, if not found, returns “No job title found”

Return type:

string

technufbot.get_title_page_info(text)[source]

Extracts all necessary information from the text string and stores it in a dict

Parameters:

text (string) – String text from a file

Returns:

Returns the title page information stored in a dict

Return type:

dict

technufbot.main()[source]

Main function that has a login page and all of the streamlit elements
